name: Fort Frederica National Monument
description: War was imminent as James Oglethorpe established Fort Frederica in 1736, to help protect the British colonies from the Spanish in Florida. Fort Frederica illustrates the story of the War of Jenkins Ear (1739-1748) and how its British defenders fought off the Spanish Army. Today, archeology has uncovered the story of the 1,000 people that once lived here.

climate.weatherDescription: The site enjoys mild climate from fall through early summer, followed by hot, humid summers.
